segments.key_quote: So, we are worshipping Krishna himself directly. Therefore, it is important that we do not mindlessly chant and hear.
segments.summary: The speaker stresses the importance of avoiding mindless chanting, as it is an offense to Krishna, and highlights the Leelas of Nama Avatara in making spiritual advancement accessible.
segments.transcript: Nama is inseparable from Krishna. Eternally they are unlimited. Krishna has a one supreme personality of the Godhead. So, we are worshipping Krishna himself directly. Therefore, it is important that we do not mindlessly chant and hear. Mindless chanting and hearing means our mind is somewhere else. While your tongue has been trained to chant, automatically chanting goes on, but the mind is on something else. Mind is thinking of some problem solving, mind is thinking of some philosophy, mind is thinking of some emotional problems, mind is thinking of some creative things and meanwhile your tongue is going on chanting. So that chanting, mindless chanting, only tongue is involved, mindless chanting. So mindless chanting is an offence. Naturally if God comes before you, if you don't give your mind to Him, is it not an offence? It is an offence. So, at all costs, we first have to come out of mindless chanting. Mindless chanting is mechanical, our consciousness is somewhere else, mechanically finishing the rounds, with no remembrance that this is Krishna before me. Because if that remembrance is there, it is Krishna before me, this Nama is Krishna Himself. Then naturally there is no question of mindlessness, your mind is on Krishna. So, we are developing this quality of worship of the sound incarnation of the Lord. Today Krishna is on this earth, doing His Leela in His sound incarnation. Because He is doing this Leela as a sound incarnation, that is how millions of people are making advancement in spiritual life, becoming devotees of Krishna and getting attached to the holy name of the Lord.
